description: Numbers n such that the number of distinct digits in n is a digit of n.
comments: The repunits (A000042) are a subsequence. Analogous in construction to the refactorable numbers (A033950).
references: S. Colton, Unpublished PhD Thesis, University of Edinburgh, 2000.
links: S. Colton, Refactorable Numbers - A Machine Invention, J. Integer Sequences, Vol. 2, 1999, #2.
S. Colton, HR - Automatic Theory Formation in Pure Mathematics
example: 103 has 3 distinct digits in base 10 and 3 is a base 10 digit of 103.
author: Simon Colton (simonco(AT)cs.york.ac.uk), Aug 25 2000
